definition: to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross

sentences.english: To forget how to dig the earth and tend the soil is to forget ourselves.
sentences.chinese: 忘却如何翻耕和照料土地等于忘了我们自己。

sentences.english: Large areas of rough grazings were brought under the plow.
sentences.chinese: 大面积的劣等草场均进行了翻耕。

sentences.english: The ground was ploughed and planted with corn.
The ground was plowed and planted with corn.
To ensure a good crop the soil had to be turned over twice.
sentences.chinese: 要保证收成好，地要翻耕两遍。

sentences.english: Around them, tractors were turning up the earth.
sentences.chinese: 他们四周，拖拉机正在翻耕土地。

sentences.english: You ought to put potatoes in there,they will help to break up the heavy soil.
sentences.chinese: 你应该在那里种土豆，它们有助于翻耕难耕作的土壤。

sentences.english: They turned the soil after the harvest.
sentences.chinese: 他们在收获后翻耕土壤。

sentences.english: Excess deep tillage would encourage weed germination and establishment.
sentences.chinese: 过多的翻耕将会导致杂草的萌发。

sentences.english: All judicial acts, vows, and tilling were also prohibited on that day Bez.
sentences.chinese: 所有的司法行为，誓言，并翻耕，也不准在这一天。

definition: to harrow/to break the ground with a hoe
